intro: Phyllanthus meghalayensis, commonly known as the Meghalayan phyllanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India, particularly in the state of Meghalaya. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
